title: Martín Gaitán
text:
Martín Gaitán (born June 15, 1978 in <a href="Paran%C3%A1%2C%20Entre%20R%C3%ADos">Paraná</a>) is a former <a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer and a current coach. He played as a centre.
Gaitán started his career with <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20San%20Isidro">Club Atlético San Isidro</a> in 1997. He soon earned his debut for the national team, playing against <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">the United States</a> team in 1998. He then spent most of the next four years playing <a href="Rugby%20sevens">sevens</a>.
In 2002, Gaitán moved to France to play for <a href="Biarritz%20Olympique">Biarritz</a> and in 2003 he was selected to be part of the Argentina <a href="Rugby%20World%20Cup">Rugby World Cup</a> squad. He was selected to play for Argentina at the <a href="2007%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2007</a> tournament, but a scan revealed that he had a blocked artery in his heart, this meant that missed the tournament in order to have surgery. He eventually had to retire from rugby because of this.
He has been the assistant coach for the National senior side under head coach <a href="Daniel%20Hourcade">Daniel Hourcade</a> since 2013.
